greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of g.f. Product_{j>=1} 1/(1-y*x^j)^A000009(j), triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
Index entries for triangles generated by the Multiset Transformation
example: T(n,k) is the number of multisets of exactly k partitions of positive integers into distinct parts with total sum of parts equal to n.
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: A[n_] := Module[{c = L[n]}, CoefficientList[#, y]& /@ CoefficientList[ 1/Product[(1 - x^k*y + O[x]^n)^SeriesCoefficient[c, {x, 0, k}], {k, 1, n}], x]];
A[12] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2020, after _Andrew Howroyd_ *)
g[n_] := g[n] = If[n==0, 1, Sum[Sum[If[OddQ[d], d, 0], {d, Divisors[j]}]* g[n - j], {j, 1, n}]/n];
b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1]*x^j* Binomial[g[i] + j - 1, j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T /@ Range[0, 16] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 14 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: A(n)={my(c=L(n), v=Vec(1/prod(k=1, n, (1 - x^k*y + O(x*x^n))^polcoef(c,k)))); vector(#v, n, Vecrev(v[n],n))}
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 14 2017
